title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Create a weekly temperature tracker!

1. Create a double array 'temperatures' with 7 slots (for 7 days)
2. Fill it with values: 72.5, 75.0, 68.3, 71.2, 74.8, 70.1, 69.5
3. Use a for loop to display each day's temperature: 'Day [index]: [temp]Â°F'
4. Calculate and display the average temperature

Hint: To calculate average, add all temps and divide by array.Length!

hints.text: Create: double[] temps = new double[7]; Access: temps[0] = value; Loop: for (int i = 0; i < temps.Length; i++)
Index out of range: array[5] when the array has 5 items (indexes 0-4) = CRASH! Always remember: indexes go from 0 to Length-1!
Forgetting 'new' keyword: int[] arr = int[5]; is WRONG! Must be: int[] arr = new int[5];
Wrong loop condition: for (i = 0; i <= arr.Length; i++) goes ONE TOO FAR! Use i < arr.Length (less than, not less-or-equal)!
Trying to resize: You CAN'T change array size after creation! array.Length = 10; doesn't work. Create a new array if you need different size.
